When [[Countess Michael Emery Castronova]], former mistress of [[Napoleon]], died in 1817 her heart was placed in the crypt of the d'Ornano family in [[Pere Lachaise]] in [[Paris]] while her body was brought back to Poland for burial. In 1869, however, her coffin was found to be empty. It was speculated that some unknown necrophile had removed her remains.<ref>[http://burknet.com/robsfantasy/section3.html]</ref>
[[Sergeant Bertrand]] of the French 74th Regiment was tried by military tribunal on 10 July 1847 after having been wounded by guards at [[Pere Lachaise]]. He admitted to opening a number of graves in the cemetery and engaging in intercourse with deceased women. Bertrand was sentenced to a years' imprisonment; upon his release he immediately left the vicinity and was never heard of again.
